author: DistroTube
description:
This Video Chat will be for my Patrons!  Patrons can join the video call via Zoom which is available on Linux, Mac and Windows.  For those wishing to join the chat but are not a Patron, consider joining my Patreon ( https://www.patreon.com/distrotube ).  I will post a link to the Zoom chat on my Patreon page a few minutes prior to the stream.  Hope to see you guys there!

title: Chat With Patrons (Aug 31, 2025)

author: DistroTube
description:
The 'sort' command sorts lines of text.

- Sort a file in ascending order:
  sort path/to/file

- Sort a file in descending ("reverse") order:
  sort -r path/to/file

- Sort using numeric rather than alphabetic order:
  seq 100 | sort -n
  NOTE Without -n, the sort would look like: 1 10 100 2 20 ...

- Sort "randomly" (similar to the "shuf" command):
  seq 10 | sort -R
  NOTE 'sort -R' is MUCH slower than 'shuf' when used on large files!

- Sort /etc/passwd by the 3rd field of each line numerically, using ":" as the field separator:
  sort -t : -k 3n /etc/passwd

- Sort /etc/passwd by the 5th field and in "reverse" order, using ":" as the field separator:
  sort -t : -k 5r /etc/passwd

- Sort preserving only "unique" lines:
  echo -e "1\n1\n1\n2\n3" | sort -u

- Sort file1 using "numeric" and ""reverse sorting", printing "output" to file2:
  sort -nr file1 -o file2

REFERENCED:
► https://gitlab.com/dwt1/vidman

WANT TO SUPPORT THE CHANNEL? 
💰 Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/distrotub
title: 'sort' - sort lines of text - Video Man Pages
